title: shrthnd predicates — is_shrthnd_num
code: x <- c("12", "34.567", "[c]", "NA", "56.78[e]", "78.9", "90.123[e]") sh_x <- shrthnd_num(x, c("[c]", "[e]")) is_shrthnd_num(sh_x) #> [1] TRUE is_shrthnd_double(sh_x) #> [1] TRUE  y <- c("12", "34", "[c]", "NA", "56[e]", "78", "90[e]") sh_y <- shrthnd_num(y, c("[c]", "[e]")) is_shrthnd_num(sh_y) #> [1] TRUE is_shrthnd_integer(sh_y) #> [1] TRUE  sh_l <- shrthnd_list(sh_x) is_shrthnd_list(sh_l) #> [1] TRUE

title: Process a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num

title: Process a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: shrthnd_num vector

title: Process a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
text: Data stored documents publications regularly annotated shorthand symbols. Often tags found container (e.g. table spreadsheet cell) value associated , requires cleaning vector extract numeric values. simple approach discard non-numeric components, however markers convey information may wish retain. shrthnd_num() provides data type can store numeric data marker. shrthnd_num() expects character vectors numeric component followed non-numeric component, formats fail. shrthnd_num vectors one two subclasses, shrthnd_integer underlying data integer shrthnd_double underlying data real number. default shrthnd_num() extract non-numeric values following numeric ones process shorthand tag. However, can optionally supply vector tags, using shorthand argument, wish validate extracted tags accept vectors specific shorthand values. underlying numeric values real numbers (.e. double() vector) digits argument used format display shrthnd_dbl vector (defaults 2 decimal places).

title: Process a character vector containing shorthand — shrthnd_num
